ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometric evaluation confirms bilateral symmetrical moderate to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ménière's disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient has a 7-year history of Ménière's disease with vertigo (currently controlled) and fluctuating hearing loss.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech recognition abilities and validate pure-tone thresholds.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The evaluation revealed a bilateral symmetrical moderate to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss with a flat configuration. Speech recognition scores were good bilaterally, and middle ear function was normal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral symmetrical moderate to moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss, flat configuration. Thresholds range from 45 to 60 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (45 dB HL AD, 50 dB HL AS) consistent with pure-tone findings. WRS 88% AD and 84% AS at 30 dB SL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A tympanograms bilaterally, indicating normal tympanic membrane mobility.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient was fit with bilateral hearing instruments and an amplified stethoscope solution. Initial fitting involved a Bluetooth stethoscope, but connectivity issues later required a change in management.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Fitting
tests.result_summary: Fit with Oticon Intiga 8 RITE hearing instruments and ConnectLine streamer. Paired with Audiologist's Choice Bluetooth Amplified Stethoscope (AC-Scope).

proposed_items: Modified E-Scope II with oversized headphones (subsequently)
counseling_actions: Counseling on the benefits of bilateral amplification for general communication beyond the work environment
Orientation to amplified stethoscope options and integration with hearing aids
Instruction on Bluetooth pairing and troubleshooting connectivity issues
Discussion of backup options such as hard-wiring the stethoscope

escalation.rationale_short: Patient was already medically cleared by otology; routine audiological follow-up is appropriate.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor device function and communication benefit.

expected_outcome: Patient reported substantial benefit from hearing instruments and realized the extent of exhaustion caused by unaided hearing loss.
The AC-Scope initially worked wirelessly but suffered from intermittent connectivity and signal transmission issues.
Patient was subsequently fit with a modified E-Scope II with oversized headphones, which met her needs.
Eventually, the patient decided to use only the E-Scope II.
